job_title: Registered Nurse, BSN in Mullica Hill, NJ
pros: Opportunities for career advancement, but only if they like you on a personal level
cons: Overall, the new Mullica Hill hospital is weird— they do not like to employ Black, Latino, or Middle eastern individuals. I have worked here for years and noticed they treat certain patients differently based on this. They especially do not like members of the LGBTQ+ community and that also extends to their patients. They make it very obvious, and will target you based on this. It’s almost as if they want the lawsuits. They value profits over patient outcomes and patient safety. The one Med Surg unit on the 5th floor only hires Men as part of their staff and the male nurse manager likes to boast about this. They violate many labor laws. Stay away.

review_title: My experience at Underwood Memorial was warm, caring, and very professional.

cons: I had no negative experiences while working with this company.

pros: As a Staff accountant, you learn a lot in a short amount of time.  Especially in Excel and the overall healthcare field.
cons: Work life balance is neither acknowledged or encouraged by upper management.  Inspira finance will be your life.  Be prepared to work upwards of 60 hours a week and weekends when necessary.

pros: Benefits are what should be expected but nothing outstanding. Depending on the plan chosen, employees are forced to receive care from employer to get a higher benefit.
cons: Employees are considered just a number and not looked at individually. Salaries are based on job title and not responsibilities, which can be quite vast considering the hiring process takes so long that few do the work of many without compensation for long periods of time. Constant restructuring of staff which results in feelings of job insecurity. Top heavy in executive management and organizational chiefs.

job_title: Unit Service Clerk in Woodbury, NJ
pros: Great atmosphere, laid back environment, ALL positive employees willing to guide you to success! Management is also awesome.
cons: I was let go because of a drug charge I received due to being in the wrong place at the wrong time. It's not really a con but I loved this place more than any job I ever had! I wish I could be there today!

pros: Local. Shared governance model for nurses. Opportunities for involvement with councils. Good tuition reimbursement. Self-scheduling on some units.
cons: Understaffed is the norm rather than the exception. Cafeteria food could be better. Self-scheduling not available on all units. Courtesy and kindness to employees is not shown as it should be.

pros: The work is great with amazing compensation. The turnover rate is low compared to other places, so I work with really skilled professionals that have been working here for years

pros: RNs were great to work with- friendly and supportive.
